notesStmt.note: Yeshayah Yisrael Hezekiah Basan and Yosef Irgas: inscribed in a note and a record of purchase, folio 1r. Folio 14r contains an ornamented owner's signature too.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A kabbalistic work of the school of Isaac Luria.

supportDesc.foliation: Original Hebrew folation in the left upper corner of every recto, pages 1-232, not including the blank leaves from folio 16 to 253. Folios 2-7 have been separately folioed.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 17th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Menachem Azariah. Sepher Hak-Kavvanoth. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,143.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 250: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [272v] (fse001v).
